clinical_study.brief_title: A Cohort Study on Biomarkers of Hypertension in Guangdong Province(GDP Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Establishing Biobank in a Cohort Study for Hypertensive Patients in Guangdong Province(GDP Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Hypertension is the most common chronic diseases and a most important risk factor for cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, and also a substantial public health problem. The purpose of the study is to investigate the association between biomarkers and adverse outcomes in patients with hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study population includes subjects who are hypertension, of any race or ethnicity, 18 or older years of age, and have provided written informed consent to provide whole blood specimens at one or more study visits.
Physical examination, questionnaire survey and biological sample collection will be conducted at baseline and the incidence of all-cause and cardiovascular mortality will be investigated during follow-up.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality was confirmed through a combination of hospital medical records, telephone contacts with patients or family members, and death registration at the Guangdong Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular mortality was defined as death attributable to an ischemic cardiovascular cause (including fatal MI, stroke).

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
other_outcome.description: The number of and the incidence rate of cardiovascular diseases.

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
other_outcome.description: The incidence rate of cerebrovascular diseases.

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
other_outcome.description: The incidence rate of hypertensive renal injure and end-stage renal disease

other_outcome.time_frame: From date of inclusion until the date of first event, assessed up to 1 year
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with reported hospitalization due to other diseases(eg. diabetes， tumor)

intervention.description: This is an observational, non-interventional study

biospec_descr.textblock: This study will collect 20 mL whole blood samples from subjects at one or more study visits. The whole blood will be processed to plasma and stored for testing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years old
- In accordance with the diagnosis of hypertension (including Blood pressure ≥140/90mmHg and/or taking antihypertensive drugs and/or self-reported hypertension)
Exclusion Criteria:
- <18 years old
- Unsigned informed consent
- Pregnant Women and Lactation
